intro: Oxera lehuntei, commonly known as the New Zealand oxera, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oxera lehuntei is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
